entry.title: Letters I didn't send
entry.summary:
Author: eliixbrown

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,171Chapters: 4/?Kudos: 25

Summary: When you were shot, part of me died. I was so scared Eddie. And look I know you don’t like me saying that it should have been me, but it should have been. Chris doesn’t deserve to grow up without you. So I would sacrifice myself every time if necessary. Sometimes when I think about what happened the taste of blood rushes through my mouth. Because I tasted your blood, and I know that I will never forget that taste. I’ve tasted your blood but not your lips. It kills me to even think about it.   Because it reminded me that losing you isn’t something I’d survive. Or: After Eddie leaves for El Paso Buck goes back to therapy and Dr Copeland gives him some homework.

entry.title: A job that slowly kills you, bruises that won't heal (I'll take a quiet life)
entry.summary:
Author: JasonToddsDevotedWife

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 74,723Chapters: 34/?Kudos: 1,341

Summary: ' Buck, speak of the devil, dropped down the last few feet. Bracing one foot against the rocky cliff and the other against the bumper, he secured his line and glanced up. The moment his eyes met Hondo’s, he faltered, foot slipping slightly against the rock.“You okay, kid?”It was impressive, the speed with which Buck recollected himself. Other than a slight downward quirk to his lips as though he had swallowed something sour, there was nothing on his face to tip off discomfort. An odd reaction, as far as he knew Buck had never met this man before. Eddie couldn’t help but furrow his brow. '   Evan "Buck" Buckley doesn't lie to his loved ones. At least, not any more than he needs to. He's made quite the life for himself at the 118 with people he loves and not a care in the world (at least, as far as anybody can tell) about his past before the 118. His past that he has historically been a bit vague about. When a blast from the past appears on a call, he is realizing that he might not have gotten away so scott-free from his past occupation. Cue Eddie noticing. Now, Buck has to navigate the collision between his past and his present.

entry.title: War Of Hearts
entry.summary:
Author: miladystark

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 16,456Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 431

Summary: Lieutenant Commander Evan Buckley has survived war zones, covert missions, and enough explosions to fill a lifetime—but nothing prepared him for Staff Sergeant Eddie Diaz, the army medic with a sharp tongue and zero regard for rank.They clash, they fight, they bleed—and somewhere between they start to fall. Slowly. Stupidly. Against all odds. Because in a world where every second counts, love is the one thing they never trained for. Sergeant Eddie Diaz didn’t look up until he heard boots and yelling.“Careful!” he said, deadpan, as the team deposited Buck—still resisting—onto the cot. “We wouldn’t want to bruise his ego any further.”“You’re the medic?” Buck growled, glaring up at the man with messy curls and sharp eyes.“No,” Eddie replied dryly, pulling on gloves. “I’m the fairy godmother. You got a wish?”

entry.title: Just one more breath
entry.summary:
Author: CarpeDiem911

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 60,651Chapters: 21/?Kudos: 266

Summary: The hysterical laughter stole every coherent thought from Buck and crawled into his bones; his heart thudded and he stared at the doll in disbelief. Then, as suddenly as it had started, the laughter stopped; leaving an eerie silence. Buck stood frozen, his thoughts like thick mud, staring at that stupid doll. He completely missed the huge hole in the wall above the tub. He missed the shadow standing there, watching him from behind the hole with cold eyes and a malicious smile.

entry.title: Please Ruin Me
entry.summary:
Author: noLongerhumannn

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,610Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 203

Summary: “Am I really so awful to you?” Buck hates how fragile his voice comes out. This wasn't supposed to happen. He wasn't supposed to fall apart today, but here he is. The grand court jester, riding his unicycle on the tight rope of death and hoping it doesn't hurt too bad when it kills him. Eddie turns to him, his eyes a storm that Buck can't look away from if he tried, “Awful? Buck you would ruin me–” The bells ring, effectively cutting Eddie off from whatever scathing remark he had planned to sear into Buck's soul like a hot brand. — Or: a hypothetical conversation leads to some realizations

entry.title: gummy sharks
entry.summary:
Author: buckasagirl

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,509Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 96

Summary: Eddie’s first shift at his new job is fine.“That could be my future husband out there,” has been echoing in Eddie’s brain since the moment he stepped into the building at four o’clock to punch in for his shift. He was absurdly giddy about it the entire drive, daydreaming about working side by side with Buck, brushing elbows, having him look over his shoulder while he figured out the computer system. Real intimate stuff.“Do you like gummy worms?” Christopher asks someone.“I do,” the voice answers, “But I actually like gummy sharks more, have you had those?”“They make sharks?” Or, Eddie has a new job and misses his future husband. (Sequel to 'gummy worms' - part 1 of my advent calendar series)

entry.title: The Third Man Factor
entry.summary:
Author: epublover

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 41,772Chapters: 3/3Kudos: 18

Summary: "What happened to you not believing in that stuff?" Hen teased. "Something change while you were away?" What, besides everything? Normally, Buck would join in on the teasing, too. Honestly, he'd probably be leading the charge— but considering the fact that they still weren't talking outside of work-related matters (which, now that they weren't partnered, turns out pretty few and far between), he chose to keep his thoughts to himself instead. The group wasn't missing much, anyways. They mainly consisted of a steady stream of what the fucks sandwiched between flashes of his dead captain and questions along the lines of when should I apologize to Eddie and how should I apologize to Eddie and will Eddie accept my apology. Buck has a bad day at work, he asks the trauma counsellor to help him make sense of it. Or; Eddie has an okay day at work, the trauma counsellor wants to talk about it anyways.

entry.title: Between Heaven and Hell: Buck’s Desire
entry.summary:
Author: caarmeeem

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 89,069Chapters: 70/?Kudos: 209

Summary: When the pact between the Buckleys and Lucifer Morningstar was sealed, Evan’s fate stopped being human. Born to save and be saved, he carries a divine gift that makes him light — but also forces him to face everything that light exposes. As a firefighter at the 118, Buck struggles with the emptiness that haunts him even on his brightest days. Until he meets Eddie Diaz and Christopher, two souls human enough to shatter everything he thought he knew about love, purpose, and belonging. But balance is fragile. Lucifer’s return to Earth unveils the bond between them and forces Buck to choose between the celestial calling that made him and the earthly love that completes him. Between heaven and hell, between the fire that destroys and the one that warms, Buck learns that salvation has a price — and that being light in a world afraid of it may be his greatest curse. A story about faith, family, and the weight of feeling everything — even what hurts. Where hell has a heart, heaven has consequences, and love might be the only form of redemption.

entry.title: Everyone Is Trying to Hit That
entry.summary:
Author: Slow_Burn_Scholar

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,714Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 43

Summary: Eddie makes a new friend who sees through him immediately and refuses to let him lie about Buck. Rae's teasing starts as harmless ribbing and turns into something sharper, kinder, and far more dangerous: the truth. As Buck grapples with unexpected jealousy and the slow realization that his feelings aren't about Rae at all, Eddie is forced to confront what he's been carrying for years. Eight years of almosts, one very observant friend, and two idiots in love finally bring everything into the open.
